title: How to Remove Glass Tiles

steps.headline: Buy some cheap Contact paper (MACtac in Canada)
Remove backing and adhere it to all of the tiles.
steps.description: Air bubbles and accuracy aren't important - just make sure all of the mirror is covered.

steps.headline: Rub contact paper to make sure adhesion is thorough.
WEAR SAFETY GOGGLES and work gloves!
Place a tarp or drop cloth under the area to catch any shards that do fall.
Break the mirror (carefully, not with strength, but finesse) with a hammer so that it cracks into smaller pieces.
Pull back contact paper and all of the glass and shards adhere to the adhesive.
In the corners where the double sided tape is still sticking to the mirror shards carefully (wearing gloves, this stuff is like razors!)
steps.description: use a putty knife to get under the adhesive and gently lift it off the wall.

text: Buy some cheap Contact paper (MACtac in Canada)  Remove backing and adhere it to all of the tiles. Air bubbles and accuracy aren't important - just make sure all of the mirror is covered. Rub contact paper to make sure adhesion is thorough.  WEAR SAFETY GOGGLES and work gloves!  Place a tarp or drop cloth under the area to catch any shards that do fall.  Break the mirror (carefully, not with strength, but finesse) with a hammer so that it cracks into smaller pieces.  Pull back contact paper and all of the glass and shards adhere to the adhesive.  In the corners where the double sided tape is still sticking to the mirror shards carefully (wearing gloves, this stuff is like razors!) use a putty knife to get under the adhesive and gently lift it off the wall.
